Package researchsim.display

Class ViewModel

  • Object
    • ViewModel
  • public class ViewModel
extends Object
    View model for the Research Simulation GUI.

    You must implement the following methods in this class:

    • updateScenarioLog()
    • saveAs(Writer)
    Implement this for assignment 2

      • ViewModel

        public ViewModel​(List<String> filenames)
          throws IOException,
                 BadSaveException
        Creates a new view model and constructs scenarios by reading from the given filenames.
        Parameters:
        filenames - list of filenames specifying the path to: the scenario files
        Throws:
        IOException - if loading from a file specified generates an IOException
        BadSaveException - if any file is invalid according to Scenario.load(Reader)
        Requires:
        filenames != null && filenames.size() >= 1
        Given for assignment 2

      • updateScenarioLog

        public void updateScenarioLog()
        Updates the contents of the scenario log and statistics text.
        If the log has no contents the method returns immediately.
        The contents of the log text should be updated to: 
         event1
 event2
 ...
        where:
        • event1 is the Object.toString() of the first event in the logger
        • event2 is the Object.toString() of the second event in the logger
        • And so on...

        The contents of the statistics text should be updated to: 

         Entities Collected: [#entitiesCollected]
 Tiles traversed: [#tilesTraversed]
 Points Earned: [#pointsEarned]
        where:
        • [#entitiesCollected] is the number of entities collected
        • [#tilesTraversed] is the number of tiles traversed
        • [#pointsEarned] is the number of points earned
        Each item is separated by the system-dependent line separator.
        No traling new line after "Points Earned:"

        For example: 

         Dave [User] at (6,1)
 MOVED TO (7,3)
 -----
 Crab [Fauna] at (1,1) [OCEAN]
 MOVED TO (3,1)
 -----
        and 
         Entities Collected: 2
 Tiles Traversed: 10
 Points Earned: 5

        Variables you will need:
        • scenarioLogText
        • scenarioStatisticsText
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs​(Writer scenarioWriter)
            throws IOException
        Saves the current state of the research simulation to the given writer.

        The writer should be written to in the following format: 

         {ScenarioName}
 Width:{Width}
 Height:{Height}
 Seed:{Seed}
 {Separator}
 {map}
 {Separator}
 {entity}
 {entity...}
        Where:
        • {ScenarioName} is the name of the scenario
        • {Width} is the width of the scenario
        • {Height} is the Height of the scenario
        • {Seed} is the seed of the scenario
        • NOTE: There is no whitespace between the ':' and value for the above conditions
        • {Separator} is a string of repeated equals "=" characters where the number of characters is equal to the width of the scenario
          i.e. width == 5 -> separator == "====="
        • {map} is the tile map grid where:
          • Each tile is represented by its TileType encoding (TileType.encode())
          • A system-dependent line separator is added after Width characters are written
            (See example below)
        • {entity} is the Entity.encode() of each entity found in the map where:
          • Each entity is added in the order it appears in the array by index (i.e. an entity inhabiting a tile with index 1 appears before an entity inhabiting a tile with index 4
          • A system-dependent line separator is added after entity EXCEPT the last entity
        For example, a simple scenario with the following attributes:
        • Name - Scenario X
        • Width - 5
        • Height - 5
        • Seed - 0
        • A Mouse located at Coordinate (1,1)
          See Fauna.getName()
        • The map is as shown in the save
          Each Tile is represented by its TileType.encode() value
        would be saved as 
         Scenario X
 Width:5
 Height:5
 Seed:0
 =====
 LLLLS
 LLSSO
 LLSOO
 LLSSS
 LLLLL
 =====
 Fauna-SMALL-1,1-LAND
        Parameters:
        scenarioWriter - writer to which the scenario will be written
        Throws:
        IOException - if an IOException occurs when writing to the writer
        See Also:
        Scenario.encode()
        Implement this for assignment 2
